conclusion: Analyze the flow direction and path of liquid to determine which container it will flow into.
Arrows A, B, and C point towards the bottom of the image, indicating downward flow.
Baffles A, B, and C are positioned at the top and designed to direct flow downwards.
Liquid will pass through baffles and continue downward.
Containers below the baffles are labeled D and E.
Liquid will enter the container directly below the baffles.
Liquid will flow into container D because it is directly below baffles A, B, and C.
